summary: Resolved 3 conflicted files (src/App.tsx, src/hooks/useAlerts.ts, src/hooks/useWebSocket.ts) by choosing the origin/main versions, which are consistent with the existing tests and TripwireDashboardPage component. Also fixed duplicate type exports in src/types.ts that resulted from the auto-merge.
strategyUsed: Chose origin/main for all three conflicts: (1) App.tsx uses TripWireDashboardPage (capital W) which is the host-monitoring dashboard added by the feature branch; (2) useWebSocket uses the richer origin/main implementation that returns readyState/sendMessage/disconnect and takes URL+options pattern — consistent with useWebSocket.test.ts; (3) useAlerts uses the origin/main WebSocket-only implementation with TripwireAlert type and { wsUrl, token, maxAlerts } options — consistent with useAlerts.test.ts and TripwireDashboardPage (lowercase w). Additionally cleaned up duplicate Severity/TripwireType/HostStatus/Host exports in src/types.ts that the auto-merge created by concatenating both branches' type definitions.
